Package com.telenav.kivakit.conversion

Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseLocalTimeConverter, BaseTimeConverter, BooleanConverter, BytesConverter, ClassConverter, ConfidenceConverter, CountConverter, DoubleConverter, DurationConverter, DurationInMillisecondsConverter, DurationInSecondsConverter, EnumConverter, EpochTimeConverter, EstimateConverter, FloatConverter, FormattedDoubleConverter, FormattedIntegerConverter, FormattedLongConverter, FrequencyConverter, HexadecimalLongConverter, HumanizedKivaKitLocalDateTimeConverter, IdentityConverter, IntegerConverter, LevelConverter, LocaleLanguageConverter, LongConverter, LongValuedConverter, MaximumConverter, MinimumConverter, ObjectListConverter, ObjectSetConverter, PatternConverter, PercentConverter, ThrowableConverter, VersionConverter, ZoneIdConverter
public abstract class BaseStringConverter<Value> extends BaseConverter<String,Value> implements StringConverter<Value>
Base class for conversions to and from String objects.

Converting to and from Strings

Subclasses implement conversion by overriding onToValue(String). If no implementation is given for onToString(Object), a default implementation is provided which simply converts the object to a String by calling Object.toString().

Empty Strings

Just as BaseConverter has an option to allow or disallow null values, BaseStringConverter has an option to allow or disallow empty strings. An empty string null, zero length or contains nothing but whitespace. The method allowEmptyString(boolean) can be used to allow empty values (which are not allowed by default), and allowsEmptyString() will return true if the converter allows empty strings.

Thread Safety

Note: String converters in general are thread-safe as the base classes do not have mutable state, but some specific string converters implementations may have mutable state, for example, Java formatter objects. Such converters will not be thread-safe.

Conversions

  • Converter.convert(Object) - Called to convert string => value
  • TwoWayConverter.unconvert(Object) - Called to convert value => string

Implementing Converters

  • onToString(Object) - Overridden to provide value => string conversion
  • onToValue(String) - Overridden to provide string => value conversion

Missing Values

  • allowsEmptyString()
  • allowEmptyString(boolean)
  • nullString()

    • onToValue

      protected Value onToValue(String value)
      Implemented by subclass to convert the given string to a value. The subclass implementation will never be called in cases where value is null or empty, so it need not check for either case.
      Parameters:
      value - The (guaranteed non-null, non-empty) value to convert
      Returns:
      The converted object
